title: The Language of Cinema
description:
This module will introduce students to the theories and methods of cinematic language. We will examine how independent filmmakers and artists have influenced the visual culture of cinema and learn practical techniques of cinematography.

Through critique, discussion and practical film-making assignments, students will work collaboratively and independently to develop an understanding of the language of cinema beyond the Hollywood blockbuster.

Students will produce a portfolio project in the form of an experimental film, video art piece or narrative short, produced in the spirit of zero budget independent cinema and video art.
prerequisite: YHU2248 Visual Storytelling or with the permission of the instructor.
